channel.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
channel.description:
This is on a amd sempron 3000+

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Good to see you back ben.
Gotta love one of the few people who decided to use math when generating points on a plane.

ruler:

Does anyone have a speed test for scar, or know a post that has data?

Kaitnieks might have left one in the test folder.

Read full topic
item.source: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

wb benland.
Back on topic

Cruel Client toptext orc.

Says it read the same text 100 times in 500 ms, meaning it'd me 5 ms per check. Although that 50 ms counted using BitBlt and other setup stuff to checking. If I were to keep rechecking, it'd go faster. But as I said, I just get using scanline in ym client and forgot to first put it all into array.

Does anyone have a speed test for scar, or know a post that has data?

Read full topic

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @benland100 benland100
item.description:
@benland100 wrote:

Sorry for bumping an old thread (;D) but, just to clear things up, semaphore did post the general (however highly specific) idea of how a spline based mouse mover would work. However, since all of the code was 100% mine and much of the origional design was lost in the development process, i did not leave any credits to anyone. The point still remains that semaphore is, as far as i know, the only one posting that has any idea how my splines work :P. And, while i’m ranting and raving, people got banned with other mouse movement algorithms also didn’t they :eek: (to whoever brought up that point ;))
If I see anything else worth responding to i’ll bump it also
(As always excuse my bad spelling :))

P.S. Since i’ve gotten over the shock of 5 AP classes and 2 honors classes you all might be seeing a little more of me, only in small doses though as I would not want to kill anyone with the shock ;D 16th birthday is in two days though, so not so much before then… OH, while i’m typing anything that fly’s through my ears, i might as well say that i’ve gotten much better at java so I hope you’ve all got some fun projects going on

Read full topic

At least, Eric/ruler is real; I can’t verify Mark’s existence as there are no inherently accurate records of him. I suppose you can use the phrase “alter ego” to describe people with equivalent viewpoints and actions, but it’s prone to misinterpretation.”

I just turned 18 this past september so i dont have very many public records yet.[/quote]

Don’t worry, I believe in you

item.source: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

As I understand it, it all has to do with your SecurityManager settings, java has one set of settings it uses for an unsigned applet, and another set of settings, almost identical to the rights and privelages of an application, for a signed applet.

So it doesnt matter whether you load the unsigned or signed client into your AppletStub because what it can or can’t do all depends on the custom SecurityManager you assign to it.

I believe this is a correct statement so can we stop arguing about fact now? It is pretty stupid to argue over a fact.

Read full topic
item.source: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

[quote=“Taios, post:101, topic:17594”][quote author=pplsuqbawlz link=topic=26416.msg329166#msg329166 date=1161240361]
Ruler, it gives the applet the same power if it’s run within an application. Just because it’s unsigned means nothing, if it can access your computer, IT WILL AND DOES. Have you even looked a deob?
[/quote][/quote]

want a test? i sugest for you to make a simple thing that prints out your UID, load it as a unsigned applet and see if it can print out your UID from you computer off of the file.

Read full topic

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Krichevskoy:

If I remember correctly, all that the “flagged” logging sent was a hash of the coordinates of a click and its distance from the previous click. I haven’t looked at the code in quite a while, but the secret would seem to be a system of mouse control that does not look suspicious to the client.

stores the mouse x, y about every 150ms send the array every click.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 19, 2006, 09:07:45 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Pwnd, post:83, topic:17594”]“never seen this “sexy client loader” also it seems he talks to everyone and tells them what to think is dectable and what not to think is dectable.”
It’s probably because he didn’t give it to you, as he did me.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Diverse are the responses of Krichevskoy.

Pwnd:

And I don’t think the Military is at all worried about bandwidth ;(

It’s actually a major concern in the development of unmanned reconnaissance vehicles, inter alia. What if you suddenly move into a place that restricts your signal? Your software detects it and throttles video quality, of course

semaphore:

So? With that kind of attitude, we all may as well be watching VHS instead of DVD or listening to 8-tracks over mp3.

newer != better

semaphore:

ruler… genodemon… whichever alter-ego you decide to manifest with today. It’s clear you are the same person.

They actually are separate people (Eric and Mark Snellman, I believe). At least, Eric/ruler is real; I can’t verify Mark’s existence as there are no inherently accurate records of him. I suppose you can use the phrase “alter ego” to describe people with equivalent viewpoints and actions, but it’s prone to misinterpretation.

frank_:

I dont know why, but I have alwys loved reading posts by Semaphore.

It is - perhaps - that they are significantly more intelligible than most.

semaphore:

Worked for ? Heh you are now on to the best kept secret in all of CM-dom. No one will ever truly know if I work(ed) for . As far as I remember, I have never ever personally said that I work or worked for them. Just because I never refuted the accusation doesn’t make it true.

Of course, the contract included a non-disclosure clause that prevents him from combining “I,” “work,” and “Jagex” in the same sentence in any RuneScape-related communications.

ruler:

Also how weird after the mass ban ppl could still bot even while as you said they were processing every mouse packet. Every mouse packet from aryan was bascially instant ban once processed. The trick was not to get flagged/pray. It was eaiser when one knew when they were flagged.

If I remember correctly, all that the “flagged” logging sent was a hash of the coordinates of a click and its distance from the previous click. I haven’t looked at the code in quite a while, but the secret would seem to be a system of mouse control that does not look suspicious to the client.

Read full topic
item.source: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow

item.title: For those that say color recognition is impractically slow
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

Pwnd:

Unsigned so you don’t have to fuck with the real loader.

I dont think the loader is a issue. Then again i do not know much about the Loader

pplsqlballz component.getBounds() refers the bounds in refrence to the container, also they dont call it in the UNsigned

Taios, the InetAddress.getLocalHost() is only called in main(), you had me worried lol

my logs:
checkConnect(String s, int i) s=‘at7.runescape.com’ i=-1
checkConnect(String s, int i) s=‘216.180.254.137’ i=43594
checkConnect(String s, int i) s=‘216.180.254.137’ i=43594

public void checkConnect(String s, int i) {
        if (s == null)
            throw new NullPointerException("host can't be null");
        ILoad loader = getLoader();
        if (loader != null) {
            if (s.equalsIgnoreCase(loader.theServer.hostName)
                    || s.equalsIgnoreCase(loader.theServer.ip)) {
                log("checkConnect(String s, int i) s='" + s + "' i=" + i);
            } else {
                AccessControlException e = new AccessControlException(
                        "java.net.SocketPermission " + s + ":" + i
                                + " connect,resolve");
                log("checkConnect(String s, int i) s='" + s + "' i=" + i);
                log("THROWING " + e);
                throw e;
            }
            super.checkConnect(s, i);
        }
        // if (s == null)
        // throw new NullPointerException("host can't be null");
        // if (!s.startsWith("[") && s.indexOf(':') != -1)
        // s = (new StringBuilder()).append("[").append(s).append("]")
        // .toString();
        // if (i == -1)
        // checkPermission(new SocketPermission(s, "resolve"));
        // else
        // checkPermission(new SocketPermission((new StringBuilder())
        // .append(s).append(":").append(i).toString(), "connect"));

    }

The things that they may use to detect me are:

getFrames() result:
sun.awt.windows.WEmbeddedFrame[frame0,0,0,764x503,invalid,layout=java.awt.BorderLayout,title=,resizable,normal]
(I think my result is the same as Internet Explorer but if it is not, i can change the toString())

Circumvent a over-ridden Security Manager and test the real permissions.
System.getSecurityManager().getSecurityContext().checkPermission();

However i can’t find any traps with me currently, but i am nub. Also i am sure any methods of dectability they produce can be battled.
